documents.document: @mcpaccard Yup. Les boites privées (en fait souvent filiales d’entreprise publiques étrangères!) promettent n’importe quoi pour gagner chaque marché, et se font renflouer par l’état après. Pour info sur l’année dernière, sur certaine lignes le nombre de train a l’heure était de… 0%.
There should be penalties for such malpractice. https://t.co/2hp10X1SHn
@gedeon We’ll see. But trailers, poster, and Downey’s salary make it dead obvious I think.
@gedeon Didn’t Cap already confirm his participation in the as yet unnamed avengers 4?

@harrybr I’d still move away from thinking about storing the “insight” to storing the solution. Could be documented as backlog of issues to fix, but the key is that addressing it should include taking that card away from backlog.
@harrybr Most findings from usability testing can be fixed faster than they can be fully documented, and become irrelevant when the design is updated.

@harrybr It’s REALLY hard to find what and how to store as insight. What is the right granularity? What’s the shelf life? Are there really ever green insights? How do you keep them fresh? (Require them to be reviewed periodically, NHS style?)
@WalterStephanie Remember it’s now built into iOS default camera app. But it’s invisible so too few know about it… It enable some very nice use cases.

@dcjarvis Also 83% of stats are made up. https://t.co/ucLL3Q1rbf
@dcjarvis @harrybr My point being they’re not really “quant” people. They like number that go up, but don’t understand check they mean what it’s claim they do.
@dcjarvis @harrybr The number of people who get convinced by quant data is sadly way higher that the number of people trained to understand proper experimentation protocol and stats.

@dcjarvis @harrybr Utter bollocks. If you’ve changed different parameters at the same time, there is no amount of participant or stat significance that will tell you what was responsible for that one metric that moved.
@andycayenne @sophiedennis Good old 🔨 is still the safest…
@WalterStephanie @s1monvdk Consider breaking into several logical pages, with validation on each. Especially for mobile.
@WalterStephanie @s1monvdk Yup, done that too.
@s1monvdk @WalterStephanie Yup. Obviously if your for. Is 3 fields long, might not be required!
@WalterStephanie If you have more than one error, you need to communicate that, can’t expect users to scroll through checking each field.
@WalterStephanie Below. (And ignore that site, always full of pseudo research) Plus summary of all errors at the top after submission attempts.
@SkyNebula @alfredapp @DuckDuckGo Dealbreaker.
@Folletto It’s not open and it’s not the web. But it does solve the problem of offering a sustainable way to finance content.
@Folletto I’m not talking about Apple Pay. In app purchases can be less than £1, are billed to your normal iTunes Store payment method. Which do group payment together to save them fees.
@Folletto IOS has in app purchase which do just that. Some newspaper have premium article, you buy credit to unlock the ones you want.

@tvaziri So sad. As a teenager I dreamt of having, basically, your job. Went into multimedia then UX design, and don’t regret it. I’ll never have my name to a movie titles, but I have a more balanced life.

https://t.co/q63GSxXknW “activity” view for shared album on macOS is ridiculous when an update was a single picture. https://t.co/uQQS0EnZwm
@sjors Some of that feeling possibly due to a poor framing of a the workshops: important to be clear when we want input to make decision separately later VS make decisions collectively in a room.
@sjors Often because many workshop are wastes of time where participants feel their attendance helps neither their own goals or the company’s?

@sjors Public speaking (which is what workshopping involves) requires confidence and ability to think v fast. Some great people either can’t do it, don’t think they can, or don’t like it. Then there’s the wide spectrum of autism where stimuli can be overwhelming.
@dcjarvis Thanks. Spikey shoes look awesome, but not sure if it’d help or not has unsure what soil I have. I do have a bit of moss… not keen on chemicals.
